definition: China Netcom (CNC), former telecommunication service provider in PRC
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Then the client opens data center in succession, look after all.
sentences.chinese: 于是客户纷纷来到亦庄网通数据中心，一看究竟。

sentences.english: Half a successed is hard work.
sentences.chinese: 胜利滴一半是尽力，网通热血传奇私服。

sentences.english: Please visit Everforex. com at a later time. We apologize for the inconvenience.
sentences.chinese: 请稍后再访问汇联金网通，不便之处，敬请谅解。

sentences.english: This paper researches the financial management of Netcom corporate under the new situation.
sentences.chinese: 作为现代化企业，网通公司的财务管理有其特殊性。

sentences.english: At present, the Softswitch network of Dalian Network has cut off and put into practice.
sentences.chinese: 目前，大连网通软交换网已割接上线，投入使用。

sentences.english: Through investigation, it was found the illegal server was located in the IDC machine room of Jilin Telecom Company.
sentences.chinese: 经查，私服服务器位置在吉林市网通公司IDC机房。

sentences.english: It shares the FNAL cable with China Telecom.
sentences.chinese: 中国网通与中国电信共享FNAL海缆。

definition: China Mobile Tietong, state-owned telecommunications operator (abbr. for 中移鐵通|中移铁通[Zhong1 yi2 Tie3 tong1])
China United Telecommunications Corporation/aka China Unicom or Unicom/abbr. for 中國聯通|中国联通
Personal Handy-phone System (PHS), mobile network system operating in China 1998-2013, branded "Little Smart"
China Telecom (Chinese company providing mobile phone service)
